tweet: Thank you for following along with me today! Tune in next time with Thusunda Brown Duckett, President and CEO, @TIAA on May 18.

name: Stanford Graduate School of Business
tweet: Chan’s advice on overcoming difficult times – “Try to understand the context that people’s lives are in and solve from there.” #GSBvftt

name: Stanford Graduate School of Business
tweet: (2/2) "It’s important to not forget about the AAPI community because we are people of color and have complex histories with race relations in this country. Just because a group doesn’t speak up doesn’t mean that they don’t have needs.” –Priscilla Chan, @ChanZuckerberg #GSBvftt

name: Stanford Graduate School of Business
tweet: (1/2) Amid the wave of anti-Asian hate crimes, Chan took a step back and did some reflection – “Social justice has been my calling, and I had not reflected on my own identity because I had kept my head down. It takes me more to advocate for myself than for others."

name: Stanford Graduate School of Business
tweet: (2/2) "I have a catalogue of faces that get me going in the morning better than coffee. There’s no choice to give up.” –Priscilla Chan, @ChanZuckerberg

name: Stanford Graduate School of Business
tweet: (1/2) “The same thing that brought me to medicine, education, and now @ChanZuckerberg is that these are people’s lives we’re touching. You can track metrics and dollars, but at the end of the day, people’s lives are complex and we need to see the whole picture." –Priscilla Chan

name: Stanford Graduate School of Business
tweet: Trained as a pediatrician, Chan advises leaders to ask, “Is it developmentally appropriate?” when analyzing their organizations. “Understand the cadence and growth of the organization, and give yourself some slack to focus on solving the right problem at the right time.” #GSBvftt

name: Stanford Graduate School of Business
tweet: On depth vs. breadth of impact – “To really create change, you have to understand both. You have to really understand the barriers that the people you’re trying to help face so that you can create impact with scale.” –Priscilla Chan, @ChanZuckerberg #GSBvftt

name: Stanford Graduate School of Business
tweet: On how she decided to take initiative and create impact – “You’re the person who can come up with the solution. If a solution doesn’t exist, you’re confronted with the question - what am I going to do about it now?” #GSBvftt

name: Stanford Graduate School of Business
tweet: At Harvard, Chan didn’t fit in immediately – “I was feeling like a failure and a fraud. The turning point was when I realized I wasn’t the only one. The most important thing that I learned was that if you hide, you’re powerless. If you name your story, that gives you power.”

name: Stanford Graduate School of Business
tweet: Chan reminisces about her path from being bullied in high school to ending up at Harvard and her thought process at the time – “I don’t know what’s out there, but there has to be more, and if I work really hard, I’ll get there.” #GSBvftt

name: Stanford Graduate School of Business
tweet: .@badassboz, Bozoma Saint John, urges us to find clarity when negotiating jobs or salaries: “What is your value in this space? What is unique to you, and what do you need to learn? Be honest about that and don’t worry about what anyone else is doing.” #GSBvftt
